docs.snippet:
TAMPA, Fla. — Kevin Youkilis knows what it is like to passionately root for a sports team. A native of Cincinnati, he has been a lifelong Bengals fan.
   
“I don’t care if a guy played for the Steelers,” he said...
docs.lead_paragraph:
TAMPA, Fla. — Kevin Youkilis knows what it is like to passionately root for a sports team. A native of Cincinnati, he has been a lifelong Bengals fan.
 
“I don’t care if a guy played for the Steelers,” he said. “I don’t care if he played for the Browns or the Ravens. Once he becomes a Bengal, I root for him. You want success for your team.”
docs.abstract: Photo of Boston Red Sox assistant hitting coach Victor Rodriguez with New York Yankees third baseman Kevin Youkilis at spring training game. (S)1

docs.snippet: TAMPA, Fla. — It’s Derek Jeter, so people automatically assume he will exceed normal standards. But it is possible that not even Jeter will be able to make the Yankees’ opening day lineup less than sixth months after fracturin...
docs.lead_paragraph:
TAMPA, Fla. — It’s Derek Jeter, so people automatically assume he will exceed normal standards. But it is possible that not even Jeter will be able to make the Yankees’ opening day lineup less than sixth months after fracturing his left ankle and needing surgery to repair it.
 
After complaining of stiffness Tuesday, and being scratched from the lineup against Philadelphia , Jeter received a cortisone shot Wednesday morning and was not expected to resume baseball activities for two or three days.
docs.abstract: MLB Roundup; New York Yankees shortstop Derek Jeter receives cortisone shot for ankle stiffness and is not expected to resume baseball activities for two or three days; other baseball news noted. Photo (M)

headline.main: Yankees Say Jeter May Not Be Ready for Opener

docs.snippet: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla. — David Wright of the Mets was prescribed five days of rest and treatment Friday when he was diagnosed with a strained intercostal muscle in his left rib cage. Five days have passed, and Wright still cannot do much more...
docs.lead_paragraph:
PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla. — David Wright of the Mets was prescribed five days of rest and treatment Friday when he was diagnosed with a strained intercostal muscle in his left rib cage. Five days have passed, and Wright still cannot do much more than rest and receive treatment.
 
“It’s getting better,” Wright said Wednesday morning. “It’s just doing what the doctor said and getting treatment and resting.”
docs.abstract: New York Mets third baseman David Wright continues to rest after being diagnosed with strained muscle in his left rib cage. (S)

docs.snippet: TAMPA, Fla. —  Away from the spotlight that is always there when the Yankees play the Red Sox, even if it is a spring training game, the team’s former and current pitching aces toiled under watchful eyes at the Yankees’ minor ...
docs.lead_paragraph:
TAMPA, Fla. — Away from the spotlight that is always there when the Yankees play the Red Sox, even if it is a spring training game, the team’s former and current pitching aces toiled under watchful eyes at the Yankees’ minor league training center Wednesday.
 
The former was Chien-Ming Wang; and the latter C. C. Sabathia.
docs.abstract: MLB Roundup; New York Yankees former and current pitching aces--Chien-Ming Wang and C C Sabathia--put in good practice at team's minor league training center, while rest of Yankees play Boston Red Sox in spring training game. (M)
